intro: Acosta polycephala, commonly known as the hairy acosta, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive textured appearance. Acosta polycephala is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
